training_organizations.name: Iowa DHS – Child Welfare Training
training_organizations.description: The Iowa Department of Human Services provides formal training for its child welfare workforce. New protective workers are trained on Iowa’s policies, family-centered services approach, and use of tools (like risk assessment and safety plans). Continued training is offered to improve practice areas such as family engagement, documentation, and supervisory skills.

training_organizations.name: Four Oaks Family & Children’s Services
training_organizations.description: A major Iowa nonprofit that contracts with DHS for child welfare services. Four Oaks provides in-home family preservation programs, foster care support, and manages aftercare services for older youth exiting foster care. It was also involved in a past pilot managing child welfare cases in certain areas, reflecting Iowa’s use of private agencies for supportive services while DHS retains case management:contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}.

policies.TribalFoster: Yes, Tribes within state provide foster care
policies.InvestQual_SW: Yes, recommended or preferred, but not required
policies.ReportAnonymous: General public (not mandated reporters) can remain anonymous
policies.ScreenerQual_SW: Yes, recommended or preferred, but not required
policies.FatalitiesReview: Yes, reviews are required for all or some cases
policies.Def_Subtype_Abuse: Physical abuse includes subdural hematoma (shaken baby syndrome) and female genital mutilation; Sexual abuse includes 13 subtypes
policies.CaseManagerQual_SW: Yes, recommended or preferred, but not required
policies.Def_Subtype_Neglect: Neglect (denial of critical care) includes 8 subtypes: Physical neglect; Medical neglect; and Other forms of neglect: Inadequate food, shelter, clothing, medical or mental health treatment, supervision, or other care necessary for the child's health and welfare
policies.EquityStaff_Specify: Indian Child Welfare Act (ICWA) and Cultural Equity Manager in the Office of Health Equity within Iowa Health and Human Services
policies.DefHarm_OtherSpecify: If the care is not provided, it will result in a denial of critical care
policies.NearFatalitiesReview: Yes, reviews can be conducted but are not required
policies.TribalFoster_Specify: The Sac and Fox Tribe of the Mississippi in Iowa (Meskwaki Nation)
policies.Reporter_OtherSpecify: A social worker; An employee or operator of a public or private health care facility; An employee, operator, owner, or other person who performs duties for a child's residential facility; Operator of a foster care facility; Employee or operator of a provider of services to children funded under a federally approved medical assistance home- and community-based services waiver; Certified adoption investigators; A massage therapist
policies.InvestReq_OtherSpecify: Identify strengths and needs of the child and of the child's parent, home, and family; Identify services available from the department and informal and formal services and other support available in the community to address the strengths and needs identified in the assessment; Consult with the child's family in offering services to the child and the child's family; Provide notice at completion of the assessment; Identification of the nature, extent, and cause of injuries if any; Identification of the person responsible for the alleged child abuse; Description of name, age, condition of the children in the same home as the child named in the report; Determination of abuse; Determination of whether juvenile court oversight is recommended; Determination of placement on the registry
policies.ScreenReq_OtherSpecify: Conduct criminal records checks on all adult subjects
policies.ScreenInfo_OtherSpecify: Incident or allegation falls within Iowa's legal definition of child abuse
policies.DefAge_VaryByTypeSpecify: With regards to maltreatment by allowing access by a registered sex offender, a child is defined as under 14 or up to age 18 if the child has a physical/mental disability
policies.EquityStaff_OtherSpecify: ICWA and Cultural Equity Manager is responsible for the partnership between the Division of Family Wellbeing and Protection and the Division of Strategic Operations to ensure integration of equity strategies across HHS while providing tailored expertise to improve services and support for linguistically and culturally diverse clients. This position will work with the Child Welfare and Community Supports Bureau to ensure federal and state ICWA compliance, facilitate tribal relations and agreements, and ensure appropriate use of federal Title IV-E training funds.
policies.DefPerp_VaryByTypeSpecify: For all categories of abuse, the perpetrator is a caretaker of the child victim with the following exceptions: (1) for sexual abuse, the perpetrator can be a person 14 years or older who resides in a home with the child; (2) for child sex trafficking, the perpetrator can be any person
policies.InvestQual_TrainingSpecify: Child Protective 200 Fundamentals for Child Protective Worker Practice
policies.AltResp_Inelig_OtherSpecify: Prostitution of a child; Child sex trafficking; The alleged abuse type includes a category other than denial of critical care
policies.InvestQual_ExperienceSpecify: 3 years of full-time experience in a social work capacity is required for individuals with a bachelor's degree; 2 years of full-time experience in a social work capacity is required for individuals with a bachelor's degree in social work; No experience required with a master's degree
policies.InvestReq_OtherCases_Specify: Required for all: (1) Identify strengths and needs of the child and of the child's parent, home, and family; (2) Identify services available from the department and informal and formal services and other support available in the community to address the strengths and needs identified in the assessment; (3) Consult with the child's family in offering services to the child and the child's family; (4) Provide notice at completion of the assessment. Required for child abuse assessments (not family assessments): (1) Identification of the nature, extent, and cause of injuries if any; (2) Identification of the person responsible for the alleged child abuse; (3) Description of name, age, condition of the children in the same home as the child named in the report; (4) Determination of abuse; Determination of whether juvenile court oversight is recommended; and 5) Determination of placement on the registry
policies.ReporterPenalty_OtherSpecify: A social worker; An employee or operator of a public or private health care facility; An employee, operator, owner, or other person who performs duties for a child's residential facility; Operator of a foster care facility; Employee or operator of a provider of services to children funded under a federally approved medical assistance home- and community-based services waiver; Certified adoption investigators; A massage therapist
policies.DefMal_Harm_VaryByTypeSpecify: Definitions for inadequate food and nutrition, shelter, and clothing, failure to provide medical care, mental health care, and meet emotional needs, and malnutrition include danger of suffering injury or death; Definition for failure to provide adequate supervision includes direct harm or risk of harm
policies.InvestReq_MHEvalCases_Specify: Common when assessing sexual abuse, physical abuse, and presence of illegal drugs in a child's body
policies.ReporterTraining_OtherSpecify: A social worker; An employee or operator of a public or private health care facility; An employee, operator, owner, or other person who performs duties for a child's residential facility; Operator of a foster care facility; Employee or operator of a provider of services to children funded under a federally approved medical assistance home- and community-based services waiver; Certified adoption investigators; A massage therapist
policies.CaseManagerQual_ExperienceSpec: 4 years of full-time technical work experience involving direct contact with people overcoming social, economic, psychological, or health problems without a bachelor's degree; 1 year of full-time work experience can be substituted for 1 year of the required education for a combination of education and work experience
policies.InvestReq_MedEvalCases_Specify: Common when assessing sexual abuse, physical abuse, and presence of illegal drugs in a child's body
policies.ScreenerQual_ExperienceSpecify: 3 years of full-time experience in a social work capacity is required for individuals with a bachelor's degree; 2 years of full-time experience in a social work capacity is required for individuals with a bachelor's degree in social work; No experience required with a master's degree
policies.AltResp_EligibilityMaltreatment: Only certain types of maltreatment are eligible
policies.AltResp_EligibilityRiskToolSpec: Intake Screening Tool - Determining the Assessment Type, RC-0142
policies.CaseManagerQual_TrainingSpecify: New worker training for case management staff (200.75 hours)
policies.ExtFosterCare_Reentry_OtherSpec: Returns to supervised apartment living foster care before age 20 in order to complete a high school diploma or GED
policies.InvestReq_PerpCrimCases_Specify: Request a history check from local law enforcement or complete an on-line criminal history check when any information is presented to suggest that such a check is advisable to be considered for the safety of the child, other children, or others. These situations include allegations of sexual abuse, domestic violence, and abuse of alcohol or other drugs.
policies.AltResp_EligibilityRiskOtherSpec: If none of the risk circumstances on the Intake Screening Tool, RC0142, are applicable
policies.AltResp_Eligibility_OtherSpecify: All denial of critical care cases that do not allege imminent danger, death, or injury to a child
policies.ExtFosterCare_Criteria_OtherSpec: Was in foster care or a state institution immediately before reaching age 18; Has continued in foster care or a state institution since reaching the age of 18; Will be placed in foster family care or supervised apartment living in Iowa; Will be placed in foster family care or supervised apartment living

A bill for an act relating to matters under the purview of the department of health and human services, including administrative services organizations, child foster care, child and dependent adult abuse, internal audit and examination information, and the region incentive fund in the mental health and disability services regional service fund, health maintenance organization’s premium tax, and making appropriations and including effective date and retroactive applicability provisions.

A bill for an act relating to matters under the purview of the department of health and human services, including administrative services organizations, child foster care, child and dependent adult abuse, internal audit and examination information, and the region incentive fund in the mental health and disability services regional service fund, health maintenance organization’s premium tax, and making appropriations and including effective date and retroactive applicability provisions.
A bill for an act relating to the adoption tax credit available against the individual income tax, and including effective date and retroactive applicability provisions.

A bill for an act relating to human trafficking, including screening children, civil statutes of limitations, an annual stakeholder meeting and report, depositions of victims, restitution, restorative facilities and protective services, and investigation and prosecution, and including effective date provisions.
A bill for an act relating to consideration of the educational setting of a minor child in a child custody proceeding.
A bill for an act relating to the creation of land redevelopment trusts.

A bill for an act relating to local government property taxes, financial authority, and budgets, modifying appropriations, and including effective date, applicability, and retroactive applicability provisions.

A bill for an act relating to matters under the purview of the department of management, making appropriations, and including applicability provisions.
A bill for an act relating to consideration of the educational setting of a minor child in a child custody proceeding.

A bill for an act relating to and making appropriations to the department of veterans affairs and the department of health and human services, and related provisions and appropriations, including aging and disability services; behavioral health, public health, community access and eligibility; the medical assistance program, state supplementary assistance, Hawki, and other health-related programs; family well-being and protection; state-operated specialty care; administration and compliance; transfers, cash flows, and nonreversions; prior appropriations; the beer and liquor control fund, and the behavioral health fund; report on nonreversion of moneys; emergency rules; more options for maternal support program; and a hospital directed payment program; and including effective date and retroactive applicability provisions.
